description: Uploads an attachment file to the specified Amazon Q in Connect message template. The name of the message template attachment has to be unique for each message template referenced by the $LATEST qualifier. The body of the attachment file should be encoded using base64 encoding. After the file is uploaded, you can use the pre-signed Amazon S3 URL returned in response to download the uploaded file.

parameters.name: knowledgeBaseId
parameters.description: The identifier of the knowledge base. Can be either the ID or the ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.

parameters.name: messageTemplateId
parameters.description: The identifier of the message template. Can be either the ID or the ARN. It cannot contain any qualifier.

parameters.name: contentDisposition
parameters.description: The presentation information for the attachment file.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the attachment file being uploaded. The name should include the file extension.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The body of the attachment file being uploaded. It should be encoded using base64 encoding.

nested_items.name: contentDisposition
nested_items.description: The presentation information for the attachment file.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the attachment file being uploaded. The name should include the file extension.

nested_items.name: uploadedTime
nested_items.description: The timestamp when the attachment file was uploaded.

nested_items.name: url
nested_items.description: A pre-signed Amazon S3 URL that can be used to download the attachment file.

nested_items.name: urlExpiry
nested_items.description: The expiration time of the pre-signed Amazon S3 URL.

nested_items.name: attachmentId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the attachment file.
